sentences.en: "Enter-taining is something that everyone in the country can enjoy," she averred.
sentences.cn: “娱乐消遣是每个国民都能享受的事，”她坚定地说。

sentences.en: A million young people enter the labour market each year.
sentences.cn: 每年有100万年轻人进入劳动力市场。

sentences.en: After discussing the budget deficit, they entered on the problem of raising taxes.
sentences.cn: 讨论过预算赤字之后，他们开始考虑增税问题了

sentences.en: Both the boys entered the army.
sentences.cn: 两个男孩都参了军。

sentences.en: Dreadful doubts began to enter my mind.
sentences.cn: 我开始产生了可怕的怀疑。

sentences.en: Enter a username and password to get into the system.
sentences.cn: 进入系统请键入用户名称和密码。

sentences.en: enter into politics; enter into negotiations.
sentences.cn: 从政；参加谈判

sentences.en: Enter our competition and you could walk away with £10,000.
sentences.cn: 参加我们的竞赛就有机会轻松赢得1万英镑的奖金。

sentences.en: Every year, 250,000 people enter the job market.
sentences.cn: 每年有25万人进入就业市场。

sentences.en: Few reporters dared to enter the war zone.
sentences.cn: 没有几个记者敢进入战区。

sentences.en: Financial matters entered into the discussion.
sentences.cn: 财政问题纳入讨论之列

sentences.en: He entered the Church (= became a priest ) as a young man.
sentences.cn: 他年轻时就领了圣职。

sentences.en: He entered the election as the clear favourite.
sentences.cn: 他参加竞选时显然最有希望获胜。

sentences.en: he entered upon a turbulent political career.
sentences.cn: 他开始了动荡不定的政治生涯。

sentences.en: I run so well I'm planning to enter some races.
sentences.cn: 我跑步很不错，正在考虑参加一些比赛。

sentences.en: Knock before you enter.
sentences.cn: 进来前先敲门。

sentences.en: She entered politics in 1996.
sentences.cn: 她于1996年进入政界。

sentences.en: She entered upon the estate of her uncle.
sentences.cn: 她获得了她叔父的不动产

sentences.en: Silence fell as I entered the room.
sentences.cn: 我一进去，屋里就静下来了。

sentences.en: So what prompted him to enter the ministry?
sentences.cn: 那么，是什么促使他成为牧师的呢？

sentences.en: The economy has entered a period of recession.
sentences.cn: 经济步入了衰退期。

sentences.en: The nations entered into a new agreement.
sentences.cn: 这些国家签署了一项新的协议

sentences.en: The patient must re-enter a world full of problems and stresses.
sentences.cn: 患者必须再次进入充满问题和压力的世界。

sentences.en: The rebels were prepared to enter negotiations (= start discussing something ).
sentences.cn: 叛乱分子愿意参加谈判。

sentences.en: The report entered into the effect of high interest rates on the market.
sentences.cn: 这报告讨论的是市场高利率的影响

sentences.en: The sentry would not let her enter.
sentences.cn: 警卫不让她进去。

sentences.en: To enter, simply complete the coupon on page 150.
sentences.cn: 要想参加，只需填写第150页的参赛表格。

sentences.en: Two men answer-ing the description of the suspects tried to enter Switzerland.
sentences.cn: 与描述的疑犯样子相符的两名男子试图进入瑞士。

sentences.en: We enter on a new era in our history. They entered upon the most dangerous part of the journey.
sentences.cn: 我们进入了历史上的新纪元。他们开始了旅行中最危险的阶段

sentences.en: You may not enter the security area without authorization.
sentences.cn: 未经批准不得进入警戒地区。

sentences.en: young people about to enter the labour market
sentences.cn: 即将进入劳动力市场的年轻人

phrases.tran_cn: 参加（竞赛，活动等）；报名参加（比赛）
(律)（作为法律赋予的权利）正式占有

trans.tran_cn: 进入，成为…的一员，开始参加，掠过（脑海），开始进入…，参加，写下，输入，登记
trans.tran_en: to start working in a particular profession or organization, or to start studying at a school or university
to begin a period of time when something happens

trans.tran_cn: 进入；参加；登记，登录；把…编入；开始从事
trans.tran_en: to start working in a particular profession or organization, or to start studying at a school or university
